alert.note: Alert for Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 5:03PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Osceola County through 545 PM EDT... At 501 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southeast of West Lake Toho, moving north at 10 mph. Additional storms will develop as cells collide with an outflow boundary draped across northern Osceola county. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Saint Cloud, West Lake Toho and Poinciana. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors! If on or near West Lake Toho, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
